docs.text: it seems that i've stopped enjoying movies that should be fun to watch .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: take payback , for example , a movie that most people seem to like .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , it's horrible schlock , straight out of hollywood's vast talent for sucking creativity out of movies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it was written and directed by a guy who should have done better ; however , maybe he did do better , after all , 30 percent of the movie isn't his own .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: mel gibson , that hollywood zombie , decided he didn't like the ending and had another director reshoot it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what a crock .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if you sign on to do a movie , then do it the way the script calls for .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: why film a movie and then look at it later and say , - no , i changed my mind , i don't like the ending .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you're fired .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: let's get someone else to do it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: - i suppose honor is dead in hollywood .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the end of the film is , of course , hollywoodized .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: which is to say that it's happy and the guy you root for beats impossible odds to win his prize .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in this case , as is most victories in hollywood movies , gibson's prize is a blond and money .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i miss originality in film , i really do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i think audiences are so starved for it that they'll flop down a lot of money in hopes that a movie will be original .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: payback's tagline - get ready to root for the bad guy - promised an original idea , but it was far from the truth .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while gibson's character certainly broke the law , he was a character that had honor ( odd that gibson himself seems to have very little of it ) , wouldn't kill in front of children and protects his blond woman .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's nothing bad about him - he's a hollywood character , a person who could never exist in real life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and gibson knows it - he spends his time trying to act like a " bad guy " , and instead comes off as pretentious and arrogant .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the story involves gibson being double-crossed by his partner ( who is a real bad guy , which made me wish that we could root for him ) over $70 , 000 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: gibson recovers from multiple gunshots , is pissed ( naturally ) , and will do whatever it takes to get the exact amount of money back - no more , no less .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he makes a point of it that it's strictly 70 grand .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a real bad guy would have made his ex-partner pay 25% interest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this idea is completely stretched out .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: gibson ends up going after his partner and the chicago mafia that his partner is affiliated with .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what i didn't understand - this is the chicago mafia .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: $70 , 000 is like spare change to them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they'd probably just pay the guy rather than go through the trouble of dealing with him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i think they'd respect a guy going through this much trouble for a simple $70 , 000 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: maybe i'm being too hard on the movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: perhaps the filmmakers were just trying to make a simple popcorn movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i read roger ebert's review and he liked gibson in the role because he is a comic at heart playing a bad guy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's why we're allowed to root for him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and it's true - gibson walks the movie as if he's smiling at a joke he just heard .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but he's wrong here .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i wanted a lee marvin or old-time clint eastwood or somebody who wasn't a comic , just an ass kicker .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as a side note , i've just checked the internet movie database and discovered that i am the 38th person to post a newsgroup review of payback .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: after this many reviews , why would anyone want to read this ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: really , i don't care .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'm just trying to gain membership into the on-line film critics society by posting as many reviews as i can .
docs.label: negative
